It was a year in which the blue bloods returned to the podium, with Kerry winning a 39th title in football which completed a treble for the year after league and Munster success, while Tipperary emerged from the pack in hurling to bring Liam MacCarthy back to the Premier County.

In Ulster, Donegal made it back-to-back provincial titles but fell short against the Kingdom on football's biggest day, while Antrim's stint in the Leinster Hurling Championship came to an end with relegation back to the Joe McDonagh Cup.

It was also a magical year for Louth, who won their Leinster football title for the first time since 1957.

With all of that providing the backdrop, let's look at what there is to come in the new year.

title: Langfuse (YC W23) Is Hiring in Berlin, Germany
description: Join the Langfuse team to build the leading open-source LLM engineering platform
fullText:
Join the team building the leading open-source LLM engineering platform

While LLMs improve a lot, we don‚Äôt see enough applications in production. Building these applications requires a new workflow of continuous monitoring and evaluation that we enable with Langfuse (learn more about our mission).

We are seeing strong traction (see metrics below), thus it is the right time to grow the team to build out our backend systems, product, and how we communicate with developers.

We are backed by Lightspeed, General Catalyst, Y Combinator, and angels. We are growing fast (see metrics below) and work with some of the best AI teams such as Samsara, Twilio, Khan Academy, and Rocket Money.

If complex technical problems & great developer experiences excite you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

‚Äì Marc, Clemens, Max and the Langfuse team

If you are excited about delivering exceptional open-source developer experiences alongside an insanely motivated team that ships, reach out!

We publicly document our core principles and processes at Langfuse to align as a team, maintain transparency with our community, and help you determine if you‚Äôd enjoy working here.

The handbook contains many more resources that define how we do things. These might be interesting to you:

Almost everything we do is public. Get a glimpse of our work here:

If you prefer watching videos or listening to podcasts to get an impression, here are some suggestions:

Langfuse is the most widely adopted LLM Engineering platform with 19,719 GitHub stars, 23.1M+ SDK installs per month, and 6M+ Docker pulls. Trusted by 19 of the Fortune 50 and 63 of the Fortune 500 companies.

If you are excited about delivering exceptional open-source developer experiences alongside an insanely motivated team that ships, reach out!

title: Texans hold out for win against Chargers to reach play-offs
description: Quarterback CJ Stroud throws two early touchdown passes as Houston Texans beat LA Chargers 20-16.
fullText: Texans hold out for win against Chargers to reach play-offsThis content is not available in your location.There was an errorQuarterback CJ Stroud throws two early touchdown passes as Houston Texans beat LA Chargers 20-16 to secure a NFL play-off spot.

title: Jota's wife thanks Liverpool fans for their 'love'
description: Rute Cardoso says it has been an "incredibly difficult time" after Jota's death in a car crash.
fullText:
The widow of footballer Diogo Jota has thanked Liverpool fans for their "love" in "this incredibly difficult time" after he died in a car crash.

Rute Cardoso posted a message on Instagram after two of the couple's three children led tributes before Liverpool's game against Wolves.

His sons Dinis and Duarte joined the matchday mascots on the Anfield pitch before the Premier League game on Saturday. Jota played for both clubs.

The Portugal forward, 28, was killed in a car crash in Spain in July, alongside his 25-year-old brother Andre Silva.

title: Why Celtic fans must 'strap themselves in' for Nancy's 'chaotic' football
description: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy said after Saturday's 4-2 Scottish Premiership win at Livingston that he wanted "a chaotic game" and that's certainly what he got.
fullText:
Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy said after Saturday's 4-2 Scottish Premiership win at Livingston that he wanted "a chaotic game" and that's certainly what he got.

The Glasgow club found themselves behind after two minutes against the division's bottom side before hauling themselves back level almost immediately.

After eight minutes they were trailing again but two minutes later it was 2-2.

Half an hour on the clock and Celtic had the lead. Fast forward eight minutes and they were leading 4-2.

All in the first half and after a run of four defeats and one win in Nancy's five games in charge - how's that for chaos?

title: Texans clinch play-off spot and Ravens beat Packers
description: CJ Stroud throws two long touchdown passes as the Houston Texans reach the NFL play-offs.
fullText:
The Houston Texans beat the Los Angeles Chargers 20-16 on Saturday to clinch a NFL play-off spot for a third straight year.

Despite a late fightback from the Chargers, CJ Stroud's 75-yard touchdown pass to Jayden Higgins and 43-yard scoring pass to Jaylin Noel in the opening six minutes ultimately proved to be the difference as the Texans made it eight straight wins.

The result keeps the Texans' hopes of winning the AFC South alive and also eliminates division rivals Indianapolis Colts, who started the season 7-1, from play-off contention.

Defeat for the Chargers, who were already through to the play-offs, guarantees the AFC West title for the Denver Broncos.

Elsewhere on Saturday, Derrick Henry rushed for a season-high 216 yards and four touchdowns as the Baltimore Ravens kept their hopes of making the play-offs alive by beating the Green Bay Packers.

title: Welsh rugby 'on a precipice' after shocking year
description: BBC Sport looks at another tumultuous 12 months for the men's game in Wales with Welsh rugby close to rock bottom.
fullText:
The curtain is about to fall on another shocking year of failure in Welsh rugby.

There was a hope that things would not deteriorate in 2025 after a haunting 2024 but that anticipation soon evaporated.

Terms like 'laughing stock' have been used to describe the current crisis state of Welsh rugby. Events of the past 12 months make it hard to disagree with that assessment.

There have been record defeats, wooden spoons, high-profile resignations, Cardiff going into administration, top players leaving Welsh domestic rugby and yet more squabbles between the Welsh Rugby Union (WRU) and the regions.

"Welsh rugby is on the precipice." That was the verdict of former Ospreys head coach Sean Holley on Scrum V. Again, hard to disagree with those sentiments.

BBC Sport looks at another tumultuous 12 months for the men's game in Wales.

title: Heaven will not switch from England to Ghana
description: Manchester United defender Ayden Heaven, who qualifies for Ghana through a grandparent, wants to play for England at senior level.
fullText:
Manchester United defender Ayden Heaven will not switch allegiance from England to Ghana to play in next summer's World Cup.

London-born Heaven, 19, qualifies for Ghana through a grandparent and the Ghana FA has been monitoring his development.

Ghana have been drawn in the same group as England, Croatia and Panama for the World Cup in the US, Canada and Mexico.

Sources have told BBC Sport that Heaven, who joined United from Arsenal in February after making one appearance for the Gunners, wants to represent England at senior level.

title: Head 'reached out' to Duckett after video
description: Australia opener Travis Head says he reached out to England counterpart Ben Duckett after a video emerged on social media prior to the Melbourne Test.
fullText:
Australia opener Travis Head says he reached out to England counterpart Ben Duckett after a video emerged on social media prior to the Melbourne Test appearing to show the batter drunk.

England began an investigation after reports of players drinking excessively during a break in the beach town of Noosa between the second and third Tests.

One video, which has not been verified by the BBC, appeared to show England opener Duckett drunk, and led to a further increase in scrutiny on the team and Duckett in particular.

"I get on with Ducky well and reached out to him to see if he was going alright," said Head.

"Everyone is still human. What you do in your personal time is up to you.

"I know we live a high profile life and some people are more high profile than others.

"At the end of the day, it is a bit stiff but I don't think there is any real issue."

title: Antetokounmpo returns to lead Bucks past Bulls
description: Giannis Antetokounmpo scores a game-high 29 points on his return from injury as the Milwaukee Bucks end the Chicago Bulls' winning streak.
fullText:
Giannis Antetokounmpo scored a game-high 29 points on his return from injury as the Milwaukee Bucks earned a 112-103 victory over the Chicago Bulls.

Antetokounmpo had missed eight games with a right calf strain, with the Bucks losing six of those matches.

The defeat for Chicago ended their five-game winning streak, but they still sit ninth and two places above Bucks in the Eastern Conference.

Elsewhere, Victor Wembanyama also made his return from injury, but his San Antonio Spurs fell to a 127-114 defeat by the Utah Jazz.

title: Silly to change England management - Root
description: Joe Root says the England players are ‚Äúabsolutely committed‚Äù to the team‚Äôs management and it would be ‚Äúsilly‚Äù to make changes following the Ashes series defeat.
fullText:
Joe Root says the England players are "absolutely committed" to the team's management and it would be "silly" to make changes following the Ashes series defeat.

Captain Ben Stokes, head coach Brendon McCullum and director of cricket Rob Key have all come under pressure after the series in Australia was lost with defeats in the first three Tests.

But England won the fourth Test - a two-dayer in Melbourne - to end an 18-match winless streak down under dating back to 2011.

All of Stokes, McCullum and Key have expressed a desire to stay on after the Ashes and their cases would be strengthened by another win in the fifth Test in Sydney, starting next Sunday (23:30 GMT, Saturday).

"In terms of the playing group, we're absolutely committed to the management," said batter Root, England's all-time leading Test run-scorer.

"Yes, we can be better and there are certain areas that we'll continue to keep working at, but that management work extremely hard.

"They might do things in a slightly different way, but I think we've made great strides as a group and a big reason for it is because of the guys we have behind us."

Root was captain on England's last tour of Australia, a 4-0 defeat in 2021-22. The tour cost coach Chris Silverwood and director of cricket Ashley Giles their jobs, while Root would later resign.

Stokes, McCullum and Key all came in for the summer of 2022 and initially revitalised the Test team. McCullum was handed a contract extension until 2027, including taking charge of the white-ball teams in 2024.

Stokes aligned his England deal to the same time period just before this Ashes series.

While all-rounder Stokes would probably remain captain after the Ashes if fitness permits, the futures of McCullum and Key will come in for scrutiny ‚Äì a situation complicated by a T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka early next year.

The coach and director of cricket do not only have to answer for England's results, but also their planning, preparation and off-field activities.

Key said he would investigate reports of excessive drinking on England's break from the Ashes in Noosa between the second and third Test, while he also apologised for what he said was a "20%" performance in the series.

title: Ex-England striker Carroll due in court after arrest
description: Former Newcastle United, Liverpool and England forward Andy Carroll is due to appear in court on Tuesday after he was charged with breaching a non-molestation order.
fullText:
Former Newcastle United, Liverpool and England striker Andy Carroll is due to appear in court on Tuesday after he was charged with breaching a non-molestation order.

Carroll, 36, who now plays for National League South side Dagenham and Redbridge, was arrested in April with the alleged offence said to have been committed a month earlier.

The 36-year-old, who has nine caps for England and was signed by Liverpool in 2011 for a then club record fee of ¬£35m, is listed to appear at Chelmsford Magistrates Court.

Essex Police said: "A man has been charged with breaching a non-molestation order. Andrew Carroll, 36, of Epping, was arrested on April 27 and the alleged offences relate to an incident in March. He is due to appear at Chelmsford magistrates' court on December 30."

A non-molestation order is a court injunction typically issued to prevent a person from communicating with another and could also stop someone from coming within a certain distance of a specific address or a place of work.

The punishment for breach of a non-molestation order ranges from a fine to up to five years in prison for the most serious of cases.

title: Ex-England batter and ECB boss Morris dies
description: Hugh Morris, the former England and Glamorgan batter and England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive, has died at the age of 62.
fullText:
Hugh Morris, the former England and Glamorgan batter and England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) chief executive, has died at the age of 62.

He was diagnosed with bowel cancer in January 2022 and, having returned to work later that year, he left his role as Glamorgan chief executive in September 2023 to spend time with his family as he underwent treatment.

A prolific opening batter, Morris had two spells as Glamorgan captain and led the county to the Sunday League title in 1993.

He also won three full England caps and captained England A on tours of South Africa, West Indies and Sri Lanka.

After retiring, the Welshman spent 16 years in various senior roles at the ECB.

As chief executive, he oversaw a highly successful period for the England men's Test team, who won three consecutive Ashes series.

Morris returned to Wales as Glamorgan's chief executive and spent nine years at his home county, helping reduce debts and ensuring Sophia Gardens was the home of a Hundred franchise with Welsh Fire based at the Cardiff ground.

Aloha Stadium demolition signals long-awaited progress on new venue
description: The demolition of Hawai‚Äôi‚Äôs Aloha Stadium is finally underway after several delays.Once home to the NFL Pro Bowl, college football‚Äôs Hawai ªi Bowl and University of Hawai ªi football, Aloha Stadium is transitioning into a new scaled-down stadium with an accompanying entertainment district. As part of the New Aloha Stadium Entertainment District (NASED) project, the new stadium is set for a projected grand opening in March 2029, and is expected to have a seating capacity of 22,500, less than half o
fullText:
The demolition of Hawai‚Äôi‚Äôs Aloha Stadium is finally underway after several delays.

Once home to the NFL Pro Bowl, college football‚Äôs Hawai ªi Bowl and University of Hawai ªi football, Aloha Stadium is transitioning into a new scaled-down stadium with an accompanying entertainment district.

As part of the New Aloha Stadium Entertainment District (NASED) project, the new stadium is set for a projected grand opening in March 2029, and is expected to have a seating capacity of 22,500, less than half of the previous 50,000 seats it held.

‚ÄúThe demolition/dismantling of Aloha Stadium has begun,‚Äù Aloha Stadium Authority chairman Eric Fujimoto said at the NASED monthly meeting on Dec. 18. The removal of furnishings and the subsequent dismantling of the facility are expected to take approximately 10 months.

The beginning of the demolition process marks a major milestone for a plan that has been repeatedly delayed. The reopening of the stadium was initially scheduled to be on time for the Rainbow Warriors‚Äô football season in 2028, but was pushed back to 2029 in August of this year.

Before its final closing after years of maintenance issues, Aloha Stadium was an innovative steel-constructed venue with movable seating sections for different sports and events.

However, the stadium, also known as the Metal Mecca, met its downfall because of that very design structure.

The steel structure was not a good match for Hawai‚Äôi‚Äôs humid climate, which led to severe, damaging rust that required frequent repairs.

During the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, the stadium with a costly history was put to rest.

With the demolition now in full swing, attention turns to the broader vision of the NASED project. The construction of the new, smaller stadium and the surrounding entertainment district is expected to cost the state $350 million.

The new Aloha Stadium‚Äôs entertainment district is expected to include 4,000 to 4,500 housing units, multiple hotels, retail and dining spaces and cultural attractions. Residential construction is projected to take place shortly after the opening of the newly renovated Aloha Stadium, as early as 2029 or 2030.

Diego Rivera - The Sporting Tribune

The University of Hawai'i Rainbow Warriors celebrate linebacker Jalen Smith's (3) fumble recovery during an NCAA football game against the Utah State Aggies, Saturday, October 11, 2025.

After playing its home games at the Clarence T.C. Ching Athletics Complex since the closing of Aloha Stadium, University of Hawai‚Äôi football is set to move back into the new facility in 2029 under a license agreement negotiated with Hawai‚Äôi Athletics Director Matt Elliott.

‚ÄúWhile there is still much work ahead, the progress being made gives all of us reason to be optimistic,‚Äù Elliott said in a September press release. ‚ÄúWe are excited to see momentum building and remain committed to doing our part to bring this long-awaited vision to life.‚Äù

As demolition progresses and construction plans take shape, the NASED project ushers in a new era for Hawai‚Äôi sports.

title: Mitch Albom: 3 types of Lions fans can all agree ‚Äî 2025 was a loser
description: What kind of Detroit Lions fan are you? Die-hard? Realist? SOL? All three have to be disappointed in the way this season went down.
fullText:
‚ÄúThis may have been our only shot.‚Äù

Dan Campbell said that nearly two years ago, right after the Detroit Lions blew a 17-point lead in the NFC championship game. At the time, I thought the coach was being bravely honest and emotionally raw.

I didn‚Äôt think he was being a prophet.

JEFF SEIDEL: Honeymoon's over for Lions GM Brad Holmes and Dan Campbell

But the Lions‚Äô Super Bowl chances have gone steadily downhill ever since. Last year, they crapped out in a divisional-round playoff upset. This year, with eight losses already, they‚Äôre missing the playoffs altogether.

Now, I can‚Äôt tell Campbell how to coach. I can‚Äôt tell Jared Goff how to elude pressure. I can‚Äôt teach an offensive lineman how to not miss his block, or show a defensive back how to play smarter coverage.

I can‚Äôt do that, and neither can you, because we are not professional players or coaches.

But we are fans. So I can offer the following three scenarios for how to deal with the latest Lions‚Äô disappointment in the months to come ‚Äî as a fan ‚Äî depending on your type.

DAVE BIRKETT: Lions need to 'give the city a team that they're proud of again'

If you are this breed of fan, then you will point out the positives. The Lions have some terrific players under contract. Campbell is an exceptionally good coach. General manager Brad Holmes has had great drafts before. And neither man is likely to sit still this offseason.

Both Campbell and Holmes have been humbled by the 2025 campaign. The loss to Minnesota on Thursday, Dec. 25, was the low point. Campbell, who prides himself on having his teams ready, didn‚Äôt get that done. The Lions looked worse than a Vikings team with nothing to play for, a third-string quarterback and multiple absences on the offensive line.

Meanwhile, Holmes had to be cringing watching his second- and third-stringers perform like Not Ready For Prime Time Players.

These two proud men, The Die-hard Fan says, will surely right the ship. ‚ÄúRemember the start of the season? When the Lions went 4-1, had a bazooka offense, and an MVP candidate in Goff? We can do that again!‚Äù

The Die-hard Fan believes the injuries were fluky-bad this season ‚Äî most of the O-line, the tight ends, and the defensive backfield. "That can‚Äôt happen again," he says. "We still have Goff, Sam LaPorta, great running backs and great receivers, right?"

The Die-hard Fan points to the Kansas City Chiefs, last year‚Äôs Super Bowl participants, who are now sitting with a 6-10 record. Does anyone believe they will never be back?

‚ÄúPlayoffs next year,‚Äù The Die-hard Fan says. ‚ÄúBigger and better. On we go!‚Äù

This fan wants to believe, but also understands a few truths about NFL football: A.) Windows open and close. B.) Other teams also want to win.

The latter is the kind of thing that got forgotten in 2025, particularly in the November game against Minnesota, the Thanksgiving game against Green Bay and the Week 16 home game against Pittsburgh. The narratives going into those contests ‚Äî the Vikings were bad and starting a raw quarterback; the Lions wanted revenge against the Pack; the Lions faced a must-win against a Steelers team with a bad defense ‚Äî all favored Detroit.

But too often in Motown, we act like the Lions are the only determinant in the game ‚Äî that all they have to do is want it enough to win.

‚ÄúHey,‚Äù The Realist says, ‚Äúthe other team wants it, too. Their players want to look good. They have guys who play hard. Unless you come in every week fully charged, healthy and in domination mode, you will always have a battle in the NFL. And a handful of plays will determine the outcome.‚Äù

The Realist admires what Holmes did in 2022 (picking Aidan Hutchinson, trading up to get Jameson Williams) and 2023 (drafting LaPorta, Jahmyr Gibbs, Jack Campbell and Brian Branch) but he also sees that 2024 and 2025 haven‚Äôt come close to producing such talent, and Holmes‚Äô inactivity at trade deadlines and free agency reveals a too-stubborn valuing of draft picks over desperately needed fixes.

The Realist looks at the NFC North and sees Chicago on the rise, Green Bay not going anywhere, and a Minnesota team that often gives the Lions fits. The Realist can‚Äôt ignore the Lions are last in their division.

But The Realist still watches with hope. He doesn‚Äôt deny the Lions' successes. He doesn‚Äôt think the 2023 postseason was a myth. He doesn‚Äôt think the 15-2 regular season last year was a mirage. He doesn‚Äôt believe in curses.

This type, ‚ÄúSOL‚Äù for short, believes all of this is predestined. It‚Äôs the Curse of Bobby Layne. It‚Äôs the curse of the Ford family ownership. It‚Äôs in the water. It‚Äôs in the air. It doesn‚Äôt matter how many promising players or stunning wins the Lions deliver. It will always end badly.

The SOL Fan doesn‚Äôt see silver or Honolulu Blue. He only sees gray. He thinks Holmes had a lucky draft in 2023 and has bungled everything since. He already wants Campbell fired. He sees Goff as a one-dimensional quarterback who can‚Äôt do anything once he‚Äôs chased from the pocket. He says Hutchinson is overrated and now overpaid. He says the Lions‚Äô training staff should all be fired, because all they produce is a M*A*S*H* unit, year after year.

The SOL Fan watches the present but only sees the past. He sees Aaron Rodgers killing the Lions' chances as a Packer and then again as a Steeler. He sees the 2023 Lions reach the NFC championship game and wither just like the 1991 Lions did, not to return for three decades.

The SOL Fan predicts doom, expects doom, and often gets it. Right now, nothing about the 2025 season surprises him, other than the fact that anyone expected otherwise.

‚ÄúThis is who the Lions are,‚Äù The SOL Fan moans. ‚ÄúExpect heartbreak. Get heartbreak. They never disappoint.‚Äù

So which are you? Die-hard? Realist? SOL? Or something in between?

Wherever you land, just know that fans in 16 other cities are going through the same thing right now, some in shock (Kansas City, Cincinnati, Washington), some in mild surprise (Tampa Bay, Dallas), some because they absolutely expect it (Cleveland, the Jets).

That‚Äôs the only thing that every type of fan can agree on.

Contact Mitch Albom:¬†malbom@freepress.com. Check out the latest updates on his charities, books and events at¬†MitchAlbom.com. Follow @mitchalbom¬†on x.com.

This article originally appeared on Detroit Free Press: All 3 types of Detroit Lions fans can agree ‚Äî 2025 was a loser

title: WMBD Prep Sports Recap: Dec. 27, 2025
description: PEORIA, Ill. (WMBD) ‚Äì Quarterfinal Saturday at the State Farm Holiday Class and Central Illinois is well represented across the four respective divisions. Normal Community, Peoria High, and the Fieldcrest boys advanced in the two boys brackets while Washington, Morton, Eureka and U-High won to move forward to the Final Four in the two girls [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
PEORIA, Ill. (WMBD) ‚Äì Quarterfinal Saturday at the State Farm Holiday Class and Central Illinois is well represented across the four respective divisions.

Normal Community, Peoria High, and the Fieldcrest boys advanced in the two boys brackets while Washington, Morton, Eureka and U-High won to move forward to the Final Four in the two girls brackets.

At the Manual shootout, the Rams came back to beat Pekin and Limestone defeated Springfield Lanphier.

At the Princeville Holiday Tournament, Brimfield knocked off host Princeville in the semifinals and Elmwood defeated Midland. The two rivals will square off in the title game on Monday.

In the girls tournament, Midland and Elmwood will face off for the championship after defeated Princeville and Tremont, respectively.

title: Lakers' JJ Redick hints at possible lineup change
description: Which Laker will get the axe as the team continues to struggle?
fullText:
Lakers' JJ Redick hints at possible lineup change originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Lakers are enduring one of the bleakest stretches of their early season, and Thursday's blowout loss to the Houston Rockets may have been the wakeup call head coach JJ Redick and his staff needed to make a change.

Redick came out of Saturday's infamous "uncomfortable" practice with enough evidence to seriously consider impactful rotational changes moving forward.

"In terms of lineups, our guys upstairs have told us 250 minutes is like the sort of target number for when lineup data starts to set and normalize," Redick told the media after Saturday's practice. "So you can look at a lineup (that has played) 11 minutes, 'Oh, look at this 11 minutes!' Yeah, we played small-ball for one game and they played well that game. You can't take a ton from that. But there's certainly trends that we're looking at and we've kind of made some decisions on about where we're gonna go."

Los Angeles' most-used lineup this season has been its starting lineup of Luka¬†Donƒçiƒá, Austin Reaves, Rui Hachimura, LeBron James and DeAndre Ayton, which has played seven games and 85 total minutes together. This lineup has also churned out the Lakers' worst plus-minus (-29).

Removing Reaves, who will be out at least four weeks with a calf strain, and inserting Marcus Smart (a fan-favorite to replace Hachimura should Redick make a change) makes for Los Angeles' second-worst lineup by plus-minus (-28).

Looking through the lineups, there are two common denominators -- Hachimura and James. James will never be benches, which leaves us with Hachimura. If there were ever a change to be made, it would be moving the sharpshooting forward to a bench role in place of more defensive reinforcements.

The Lakers take on the Sacramento Kings on Sunday.

title: Lane Kiffin, Malik Nabers snap picture at 2025 Texas Bowl
description: LSU football legend Malik Nabers ran into the incoming head coach of the Tigers Lane Kiffin at the Texas Bowl.
fullText:
Lane Kiffin, Malik Nabers snap picture at 2025 Texas Bowl appeared first on ClutchPoints. 

Lane Kiffin must take lots of steps to win over the LSU football fanbase. Kiffin managed to draw laughs with a grocery store moment. But he took a new step in winning over a rabid fanbase with an action involving Malik Nabers and the Texas Bowl.

Kiffin pulled into the Saturday bowl game his future team was playing in. Amid the LSU versus Houston contest, he spotted the legendary Tigers wide receiver.

Kiffin managed to draw new likes, retweets and comments ‚Äî by snapping this photo.

‚Å¶@LSUfootball‚Å© pic.twitter.com/r4iidDEQMD

‚Äî Lane Kiffin (@Lane_Kiffin) December 28, 2025

While considered a simple photo, it‚Äôs still enough for Kiffin to draw new interest among a curious group of fans. Kiffin clearly wants to have good relations with LSU ‚Äî and that includes interacting with beloved Tiger players like Nabers.

Before taking on the nation‚Äôs No. 21 team, Kiffin and LSU dealt with one roster departure.

Left tackle Tyree Adams opted to enter the College Football Transfer Portal on Saturday morning. Adams rises as a pivotal early loss for the incoming head coach ‚Äî with the offensive lineman surrendering zero sacks in 11 starts. He has two years of eligibility left.

Kiffin will need to hit the portal to find his replacement. Or he can insert incoming freshman Brysten Martinez as the blindside protector moving forward. He was a local signing for the 2026 class out of Gonzalez, La., and heads to Baton Rouge as a four-star signing.

LSU, meanwhile, engaged in a close contest with the Big 12 representative as UH led 28-21 before the start of the fourth quarter.

title: How the Rockets Stayed in Control Without Alperen ≈ûeng√ºn
description: Houston reinvented its game, redistributing responsibility and embracing a defense-first approach to dominate Cleveland.
fullText:
Playing without Alperen ≈ûeng√ºn should change the math for the Houston Rockets. On Saturday night, it only changed the look- and not in a way Cleveland was ready for.

With ≈ûeng√ºn sidelined by a calf issue, Houston didn‚Äôt try to replace his production possession by possession. They redistributed responsibility. The offense flattened out, the pace stayed controlled, and the hierarchy became simple: defend first, move the ball early, and let Kevin Durant dictate when scoring was needed.

Without Houston‚Äôs usual post hub on the floor, Durant became both the pressure point and the release valve. He scored early, drew attention without forcing shots, and punished Cleveland for never fully committing to a double. He didn‚Äôt play hero ball, but he did ensure structure was maintained and embraced his role within it.

Steven Adams anchored the paint, controlled the glass, and kept Cleveland from getting second chances. Tari Eason brought disruption and energy in the gaps. Reed Sheppard spaced the floor and punished late rotations. Everyone stayed in their lane.

Defensively, the Rockets looked even more locked in. Without ≈ûeng√ºn‚Äôs playmaking responsibilities to manage, Houston simplified reads, stayed connected, and turned stops into rhythm without rushing. And Cleveland never found a clean way to speed the game up.

Saturday night proved that not only can Houston survive without ≈ûeng√ºn- they can toggle styles when needed by leaning on defense, rebounding, and discipline, instead of flow. That kind of adaptability is the difference between a good team and a serious one.

title: The chalk walks into semifinals for Blue & Gold, Pink & White Tournaments
description: SPRINGFIELD‚ÄìFor the second straight day, all four No. 1-seeds advanced in the annual Blue & Gold, Pink & White Lady Classic Tournaments. In the 80th Annual Blue & Gold Tournament, Nixa, the No. 1 seed in Gold Division, thrashed the Strafford Indians, 84-47. The Eagles had four players score 10-or-more points, including Ty Kellis with [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
SPRINGFIELD‚ÄìFor the second straight day, all four No. 1-seeds advanced in the annual Blue & Gold, Pink & White Lady Classic Tournaments.

In the 80th Annual Blue & Gold Tournament, Nixa, the No. 1 seed in Gold Division, thrashed the Strafford Indians, 84-47. The Eagles had four players score 10-or-more points, including Ty Kellis with a game-high 21, followed by Adam McKnight with 19.

Nixa will go against No. 5-seeded Branson in the semifinals, Monday at 4 p.m. The winner will play in the championship game on Tuesday against the winner of No. 2-seed Hartville and unseeded West Plains.

In the Blue Division, top-seeded Logan-Rogersville didn‚Äôt miss a beat bashing the Pirates of Crane, 68-38. Chase Branham led all scorers with 19 points. Teammate Jack Sutherland recorded the second-most points with 18 in the contest.

The Wildcats face No. 4-seed Glendale in Monday‚Äôs semifinal, at 7pm, after the Falcons hammered the Marshfield Jays, 91-67.

At the 14th Annual Pink and White Lady Classic, both No. 1-seeds, Kickapoo and Strafford got the job done, on Saturday, but neither had a blowout victory like they enjoyed in Friday‚Äôs opening games.

Strafford barely held off No. 8-seed, Willard in a 59-56 battle. The Lady Indians used their size and quickness to score several transition baskets, and knocked down key free throws to come away with the 3-point win. Strafford tangles with No. 4-seed Republic, on Monday, at 2 p.m. in the Pink Bracket semifinals.

Finally, the Kickapoo Lady Chiefs defeated the Lady Bobcats of Thayer, 56-45 in a physical game. Anaya Perry scored a team-high 20 points to lead the Lady Chiefs to victory. She made buckets from inside and outside the arch to help her team reach the White Bracket semifinals, where they‚Äôll play No. 4-seed Hillcrest, after the Hornets knocked off No. 5-seed Skyline.

title: PSG Standout on Real Madrid‚Äôs Radar Should Vinicius Jr. Leave
description: Xabi Alonso is approaching the midpoint of his first season in charge at Real Madrid, and the early stretch has offered a clearer picture of what is working and what still needs reinforcement. Midfiel...
fullText:
Xabi Alonso is approaching the midpoint of his first season in charge at Real Madrid, and the early stretch has offered a clearer picture of what is working and what still needs reinforcement. Midfield has emerged as a key talking point, with the club reportedly keeping close tabs on PSG standout Vitinha.

Any attempt to land the Portuguese midfielder would come with obvious challenges. PSG relied heavily on Vitinha alongside Fabi√°n Ruiz and Jo√£o Neves during a dominant 2024‚Äì25 campaign that delivered Ligue 1, the UEFA Champions League, and the Coupe de France.

Still, Madrid‚Äôs spending power could complicate matters. A serious offer might prompt PSG to listen, opening the door to discussions that could extend to Vitinha himself and whether a move away from Par√≠s is worth considering.

According to Cadena SER, Real Madrid have identified Vitinha as a potential target if Vinicius Jr. departs during the summer window. The club would aim to free up significant salary space from such an exit and redirect those funds toward a move for the PSG midfielder.

Despite being tied to PSG until 2029, Vitinha¬†wouldn‚Äôt rule out a future move to Spain¬†during¬†a recent interview with¬†O Jogo.

‚ÄúLa Liga is fantastic and suits my style of play better,‚Äù Vitinha said (h/t¬†Le10Sport). ‚ÄúI would like to play there one day. But it‚Äôs difficult to set goals. You have to take things step by step.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve already played in the Premier League, but at Wolverhampton I didn‚Äôt get as much playing time as I would have liked, especially during the Covid period, which prevented me from fully enjoying the atmosphere in the stadiums.‚Äù

title: New Michigan coach Kyle Whittingham resets football culture with inspiring message
description: New Michigan Wolverines coach Kyle Whittingham has already showcased a culture shift in Ann Arbor without coaching a game just yet. It's officially a new era.
fullText:
New Michigan coach Kyle Whittingham resets football culture with inspiring message originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Michigan Wolverines hiring Kyle Whittingham isn't just a breath of fresh air. It's the definition of a complete foundational rebuild.

Whittingham was announced as the team's coach Friday, replacing Sherrone Moore. Whittingham was previously the coach of the Utah Utes for over two decades before accepting the Wolverines' job. Upon accepting the position, Whittingham made it clear what his intentions are centered on, leading consistently.

"Michigan fans, coach Kyle Whittingham,"¬†Whittingham said in a video on 'X. '¬†"Honored to be here, honored to be the football coach of this great university. Can't wait to get working with our players, getting to know them and getting Michigan football to where it should be."

Whittingham released a much longer statement, too, further emphasizing where he'd like to see the program head.

"We are honored to lead the outstanding student-athletes, coaches, and staff who represent Michigan Football each day," Whittingham said. "Michigan is synonymous with tradition and excellence‚Äîboth on the field and beyond‚Äîand our entire program is committed to upholding those values while striving for greatness together. My family and I are thrilled to join the University of Michigan community, and we look forward to helping our players grow, develop, and reach their highest potential‚Äîon the gridiron, in the classroom, and as leaders. It‚Äôs a privilege to be part of something that inspires pride in every Wolverine fan. Go Blue!‚Äù

AD Warde Manuel echoed those words.

‚ÄúKyle Whittingham is a well-respected and highly successful head coach who is widely recognized as a leader of exceptional character and principled leadership," Manuel said. "Throughout our search, he consistently demonstrated the qualities we value at Michigan: vision, resilience, and the ability to build and sustain championship-caliber teams. Kyle brings not only a proven track record of success, but also a commitment to creating a program rooted in toughness, physicality, discipline and respect‚Äîwhere student-athletes and coaches represent the university with distinction both on and off the field. We are excited to welcome Kyle to the University of Michigan family as he takes the helm of our football program.‚Äù

Ultimately, it seems the Wolverines are happy with how they view Whittingham. Whether it translates to wins, though, is a different story.

title: Packers Snap Counts: Rashan Gary down to DE3 in Week 17 vs. Ravens
description: Both Kingsley Enagbare and Lukas Van Ness finished with more snaps played than Rashan Gary on Saturday.
fullText:
The Green Bay Packers got banged up against the Baltimore Ravens. Quarterback Malik Willis (shoulder), receiver Dontayvion Wicks (concussion), defensive tackle Jordon Riley (Achilles), cornerback Nate Hobbs (knee), cornerback Kamal Hadden (ankle) and safety Zayne Anderson (ankle) all got injured and didn‚Äôt return to action for the Packers. On top of that, there were injuries coming into the game, and Green Bay played the reserve offense to end the second half, as they were already down 41-24 in the closing minutes of the game.

So let‚Äôs go through the Packers‚Äô snap counts against the Ravens, which might have been Green Bay‚Äôs last game at Lambeau Field this year, and talk through what happened in the game position-by-position.

Obviously, starting quarterback Jordan Love missed this game due to a concussion. Willis stepped in and played well, but suffered a non-contact reaggravation of his shoulder injury from last week, which forced practice squadder Clayton Tune into the lineup. After the game, head coach Matt LaFleur said that Willis could have been sent back in, and also that Love hasn‚Äôt passed the concussion protocol yet.

It sure seems like the Packers are taking it easy with Josh Jacobs, even when the division was still on the line. Jacobs has been battling a multi-month knee injury at this point and was out-snapped by both Chris Brooks, usually a blocking back, and Emanuel Wilson, the team‚Äôs route-runner. I‚Äôm going to go ahead and assume that Jacobs won‚Äôt be getting many opportunities against the Minnesota Vikings this week.

With Dontayivion Wicks getting injured early and Savion Williams being out with an illness, Bo Melton again had to play offense in this game. The thin depth chart also helped get Matthew Golden on the field more. On 24 plays, Golden finished with one reception for 12 yards.

With John FitzPatrick suffering a season-ending Achilles injury, the Packers brought up practice squadder Drake Dabney for this game. He got most of his playing time in garbage time, though. Instead, Josh Whyle really served the role of the starting tight end in a rotation with Luke Musgrave.

The starting unit was Rasheed Walker, Aaron Banks, Sean Rhyan, Anthony Belton and Jordan Morgan (left to right) with Zach Tom still dealing with knee and back injuries. Kinnard only got in on two plays as an extra tight end, with one of them being the first play of the game: A deep shot to receiver Romeo Doubs. Both Jacob Monk and Donovan Jennings were on the bench watching the offense until garbage time.

It sure seems like Rashan Gary got benched! Even without Micah Parsons in the mix, Gary only played 33 snaps in this game, fewer than either Kingsley Enagbare or Lukas Van Ness. In total, Gary only played 45 percent of the Packers‚Äô defensive snaps in this game. This was probably his last game in green and gold at Lambeau.

Rookie draft picks Collin Oliver and Barryn Sorrell were both healthy scratches in this game.

The Packers had five defensive tackles up for this game, but rookie Nazir Stackhouse was a healthy scratch. It sure seems like Stackhouse is now DT6 on the depth chart, which would be DT7 if Devonte Wyatt were healthy. Green Bay is basically redshirting him this year, hoping that he takes the next step next summer.

The Packers played an extra defensive tackle on 16 plays to try to stop the Ravens‚Äô rushing attack. The extra body did not help.

Green Bay only had four linebackers up, following the placement of Kristian Welch on the injured reserve. To make up for that, both Edgerrin Cooper and Quay Walker had to play a lot more special teams snaps for the team this week. Isaiah McDuffie was on the field nearly two-thirds of the time, as Baltimore was fine playing a heavy-on-heavy game against the Packers.

57: Carrington Valentine (2 SPT)

The physicality of Carrington Valentine, when facing running back Derrick Henry, was a major problem in this game. The Packers first tried to bench Valentine situationally to get Nate Hobbs on the field. Then Hobbs got hurt.

Then the Packers benched Valentine to get Kamal Hadden on the field. Then Hadden got hurt.

Green Bay is now down to three healthy cornerbacks on the 53-man roster, and one of them is Bo Melton, who has only played receiver and special teams this year.

Before the Nate Hobbs injury, the Packers were trying to get Javon Bullard some snaps at safety to help stop the run, which displaced Evan Williams. After the Hobbs injury, though, Bullard had to move back into the slot, in place of Hobbs, and Bullard and Williams shared the safety position situationally.

Anderson also went down with an injury. Everyone is hurt. This team is very banged up.

title: Virginia's Chandler Morris masterful in 19-play Gator Bowl drive
description: Down at halftime of the Gator Bowl, Virginia swung momentum with a 19-yard, 10-minute march. Here's a closer look at the touchdown drive.
fullText:
Chandler Morris long ago lost count of all the drives from a college football career that has carried him to Oklahoma, TCU, North Texas and now Virginia.

But Virginia's graduate quarterback, now a day past his 25th birthday, said he's never experienced a marathon march quite like the one that earned a place in the annals of the TaxSlayer Gator Bowl.

"That was my first," Morris said. "Out in the Florida heat, I guess, we haven't been too used to it, too."

The bowl doesn't maintain complete records for longest drive in its 81-year history, but the Morris-led march of 19 plays, 75 yards, 10 minutes and 7 seconds to open the second half of the Cavaliers' 13-7 win against Missouri on Dec. 27 will rank among the most important.

This was football for the tortoise, not the hare. Just the way Virginia head coach Tony Elliott wanted.

"That's an offense on the other sideline that can get going at any time, that can rip off big runs for touchdowns, that can find big plays in the passing game," Elliott said. "So we wanted to try and control the game a little bit where we could, and see if we could possess the ball."

Opening the half with a 7-3 deficit on its own 25, Virginia embarked on a gritty, grinding slow-motion drive through the Jacksonville night. Nine running plays gained 4 yards or fewer. The possession looked spoiled from the start: Missouri (8-5) drove Harrison Waylee backward for a loss of 2 on first down and Morris threw incomplete on second.

But after three third-down conversions, two fourth-down conversions, two direct snaps to a tailback and even a variant of the swinging-gate formation, Waylee plunged in from 2. The EverBank Stadium end zone. The lead.

"What I'm thinking is, 'Thank you for bailing me out [on the fourth-down gambles],'" Elliott said.

At Virginia, Elliott said, they call it "Polecat."

From an unorthodox formation ‚Äî three linemen split wide, spreading the defense in unpredictable ways ‚Äî Morris caught the confused Tigers off guard and fired a strike to tight end Sage Ennis at the Mizzou 12, the biggest play in a procession of small ones.

Morris completed 7 of 9 passes for 52 yards on the drive, spreading the ball among five different Cavalier pass-catchers. Four different rushers kept the chains moving, and frustrated the Tigers.

"It was just execution on our parts, nothing we hadn't prepared for," Missouri linebacker Nick Rodriguez said.

No. 21 Virginia (11-3) changed up its offense, and really had no choice. Leading receiver Trell Harris (59 catches, 847 yards) missed the game with a knee injury, and top running back J'Mari Taylor (1,062 yards rushing, 14 TD) never took the field in an apparent bowl opt-out.

Slow. Steady. A drive that won't ignite a viral highlight wildfire online. But Virginia wouldn't be taking a bowl title back to Charlottesville, or celebrating a first-ever 11-win season, without it.

"To be able to go out there and really take over the line of scrimmage and punch it in the end zone, putting seven points on the board that drive was really big," Morris said.

Virginia's 19-play Gator Bowl drive

First and 10, Virginia 25: Harrison Waylee run for loss of 2.

Second and 12, Virginia 23: Chandler Morris pass incomplete.

Third and 12, Virginia 23: Morris pass to Eli Wood for 13.

First and 10, Virginia 36: Morris pass to Waylee for 4.

Second and 6, Virginia 40: Morris run for 2.

Third and 4, Virginia 42: Morris run for 2.

Fourth and 2, Virginia 44: Morris pass to Cam Ross for 6.

First and 10, 50: Morris pass to Kameron Courtney for 3.

Second and 7, Missouri 47: Davis Lane Jr. run for 2.

Third and 5, Missouri 45: Waylee run for 2.

Fourth and 3, Missouri 43: Morris pass to Waylee for 5.

First and 10, Missouri 38: Morris pass incomplete.

Second and 10, Missouri 38: Xay Davis run for 8.

Third and 2, Missouri 30: Davis run for 3.

First and 10, Missouri 27: Morris pass to Sage Ennis for 15.

First and 10, Missouri 12: Morris run for 2.

Second and 8, Missouri 10: Morris pass to Ross for 6.

Third and 2, Missouri 4: Waylee run for 2.

First and goal, Missouri 2: Waylee touchdown run for 2.

This article originally appeared on Florida Times-Union: Virginia football's 19-play drive at Gator Bowl

title: Fantasy Football start/sit recommendations for the 49ers in Week 17
description: The San Francisco 49ers and Chicago Bears will meet at Levi's Stadium on Sunday. Here's what fantasy owners should do with their Rams in Week 17.
fullText:
After beating the Indianapolis Colts on Monday night at Lucas Oil Stadium, the San Francisco 49ers are back in action on Sunday for another primetime matchup, this time against the Chicago Bears at Levi's Stadium.

With these two teams still fighting for playoff seeding, this game will have everyone's attention for the national broadcast, but fantasy owners will be just as glued in because this is the championship in most leagues.

Before the Sunday night showdown, let's take a look at what fantasy owners should be doing with their 49ers this week to try and win a title:

Purdy threw for five touchdowns against the Colts and is coming off winning NFC Offensive Player of the Week honors. This year, only seven quarterbacks have averaged more fantasy points per game than Purdy, and one of those is Patrick Mahomes, who won't be playing in Week 17. Even possibly without two of his best weapons this week, he should get the start.

Chicago may be a top-10 defense against opposing running backs in fantasy football, but McCaffrey's usage is simply too much to leave him on the bench.

Jennings has been a WR3 or flex play this year, but he's found the end zone in six of his last seven games, scoring twice against the Tennessee Titans in Week 15. As the team's primary receiver, he should probably get the start.

Kittle didn't finish last week's battle with the Colts due to an ankle injury that he tried to play through. He didn't practice all week, and with the playoffs in just a few weeks, they may not try to push it. Even if he's active, he may be more of a decoy than anything.

New Bears head coach and offensive playcaller Ben Johnson can present plenty of problems for the 49ers defense, which is without their two best players. After getting carved up by 44-year-old Philip Rivers last week, it's hard to have must confidence in the group right now.

More 49ers: RB Christian McCaffrey cracks top 10 in 49ers rushing yards

This article originally appeared on Niners Wire: 49ers vs. Bears: Fantasy start/sit recommendations for San Francisco

title: Manchester City picked up a win yesterday that felt much bigger than simply picking up three points
description: Manchester City had to scrap and dig deep to beat Nottingham Forest 2-1 at The City Ground yesterday. Tijjani Reijnders opened the scoring yesterday in the 48th minute before Omari Hutchinson equalise...
fullText:
Manchester City had to scrap and dig deep to beat Nottingham Forest 2-1 at The City Ground yesterday. Tijjani Reijnders opened the scoring yesterday in the 48th minute before Omari Hutchinson equalised for Forest six minutes later. Rayan Cherki scored the winner for Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side in the 83rd minute of yesterday‚Äôs match. The City players and staff celebrated hard at the final whistle after they saw off Sean Dyche‚Äôs determined and well-organised team. City picked up a massive three points yesterday but Manchester City‚Äôs win over Nottingham Forest felt bigger than that come the final whistle.

Nottingham Forest didn‚Äôt allow Manchester City to be at their free-flowing best yesterday. Sean Dyche‚Äôs side were well-organised defensively and their threat on the counter and in the final third was ever-present throughout yesterday‚Äôs match. Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side had to fight, scrap, and rely on their mentality to overcome a determined opponent. A magical second-half display from Rayan Cherki did help City pick up a massive win. But the mentality of this Manchester City squad did help them overcome a tough opponent yesterday.

While City picked up a vital three points yesterday to keep in touch with Premier League leaders Arsenal, their win over Nottingham Forest felt bigger than that. It was Manchester City‚Äôs eighth consecutive win in all competitions. But the confidence and belief that this City team should gain from yesterday‚Äôs win could prove to be invaluable. It isn‚Äôt out of the realm of possibility that Manchester City‚Äôs win yesterday could be looked back upon as a pivotal point in Manchester City‚Äôs season.

Speaking after his team‚Äôs win over Nottingham Forest, Pep Guardiola said that his team‚Äôs win over Sean Dyche‚Äôs side was a massive victory. He had high praise for Nottingham Forest and the fact that City overcame them meant the win City picked up yesterday was a big one. He explained: ‚ÄúWinter time, Nottingham Forest away‚Ä¶ I know the memory is weak, but when we won one of the six Premier Leagues this type of game happens a lot. Three points, but it‚Äôs a massive three points, mainly for the quality of the opposition.‚Äù

Pep Guardiola also praised his team‚Äôs mentality. City weren‚Äôt at their best but they found a way to win yesterday. Guardiola added: ‚ÄúWe talked about that; we needed an incredible mentality. It‚Äôs more important how you suffer and defend, accept you can be better and be in the game, otherwise, no chance will you win, that game last season we lost. Since then, a long time the team want to do it and of course, the last game of the first leg of the season it‚Äôs good to finish with this important three points.‚Äù

Manchester City picked up a massive win yesterday over Nottingham Forest. City‚Äôs win felt bigger than simply picking up three valuable points. Yesterday‚Äôs result felt like a big moment in Manchester City‚Äôs season and the confidence and belief City will take from the match yesterday could prove to be invaluable as this season progresses. This Manchester City side has a strong mentality and that stood out yesterday as they dug deep to beat Sean Dyche‚Äôs side. That mentality is the foundation of this City side and it could potentially form the backbone of any success City achieve this season.

title: Kenny Atkinson made shocking admission after Cavs‚Äô loss to Rockets
description: Atkinson is running out of ways to describe his team‚Äôs poor performances.
fullText:
The Cleveland Cavaliers reached a new low on Saturday as they dropped their game with the Houston Rockets 117-100.

The fact that the Cavs lost wasn‚Äôt necessarily cause for alarm. The Rockets are one of the best teams in the Western Conference and pose significant matchup disadvantages for Cleveland. How they lost was the issue.

The Cavaliers came out of the gates flat, as if just showing up was enough to win them the game. This was a red flag for Cavs‚Äô head coach Kenny Atkinson, who seemingly knew the outcome just a few minutes after tip-off.

‚ÄúI rarely say this, but I thought the game was over in the first quarter,‚Äù Atkinson said postgame. ‚ÄúTheir physicality, we weren‚Äôt ready for the fight tonight. I don‚Äôt know how else to say it.‚Äù

Anything bought from the links helps support Fear the Sword. You can find this comfortable Cuyahoga Valley National Park hoodie HERE. All of of Homage‚Äôs Cavs gear can be found HERE.

Atkinson‚Äôs assessment was accurate. The Cavaliers weren‚Äôt ready for this game and didn‚Äôt come out with the energy and effort they needed to. This is a team that hasn‚Äôt been able to turn the momentum around if they don‚Äôt come out as the aggressors. That said, it‚Äôs surprising to hear a head coach admit that after yet another disappointing loss.

A lack of preparation and focus reflects poorly on the head coach. And while it‚Äôs unfair to blame Atkinson entirely for this group‚Äôs issues, it‚Äôs undeniable that the team isn‚Äôt playing hard for him on a nightly basis like they were last season.

The most frustrating part of Saturday‚Äôs game for the Cavs is the fact that it came on the heels of what was a good week. They won two straight games with convincing victories over the Charlotte Hornets and New Orleans Pelicans, before playing well enough to defeat the New York Knicks, but ultimately failing to do so due to poor late-game execution.

‚ÄúI was encouraged after the Knicks game, because we were ready for the fight,‚Äù Atkinson said. ‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt the same team that played the other night against the Knicks.‚Äù

The loss brings the Cavs‚Äô record to 17-16. And while there‚Äôs still plenty of games left in the regular season, they‚Äôre running out of time to show that this group is capable of rallying and making a playoff push. Cleveland now sits eighth in the Eastern Conference and is eight games behind the Detroit Pistons for the top spot.

title: Keys for the Bengals to beat the Arizona Cardinals
description: Keys for Joe Burrow and the Bengals to earn a second straight victory when they meet the Arizona Cardinals on Dec. 28.
fullText:
The Cincinnati Bengals host the Arizona Cardinals at Paycor Stadium on Sunday, Dec. 28, in the penultimate game of the season in Week 17.

The Bengals (5-10) are coming off a 45-21 win over the Miami Dolphins and the Cardinals (3-12) are coming off a 26-19 loss to the Atlanta Falcons.

Cincinnati will finish third in the AFC North and Arizona will finish last in the NFC West this season.

Bengals awards Ja'Marr Chase Ja'Marr Chase: Earning Pro Bowls will never get old

Bengals Cardinals Joe Burrow Christmas 7 gifts Joe Burrow received for Christmas

Quarterback Joe Burrow will lead the Bengals' offense and is 2-2 since returning from a turf toe injury in Cincinnati's win over the Baltimore Ravens on Thanksgiving.

The game can be seen on FOX-TV (Channel 19) and is on the Bengals radio network WLW-AM (700), WCKY-AM (1530) and WEBN-FM (102.7). Kickoff is scheduled for 1 p.m.

Here are the keys to a Bengals' victory:

Burrow and the offense had their full complement of weapons with wide receiver Tee Higgins returning from concussion protocol in the Week 16 win over the Dolphins. The result was Burrow being named the FedEx Air & Ground Player of the Week alongside Jacksonville Jaguars quarterback Trevor Lawrence.

Burrow was 25-for-32 passing for 309 yards and four touchdowns. If the Bengals can keep close to that pace on offense, it'll be hard for the Cardinals to keep up.

The Bengals also led time of possession in Week 16, which helps the defense.

The Bengals had a historically bad defense through the first half of the season. They lost back-to-back games this year when scoring 38 and 42 points, respectively, to the New York Jets and Chicago Bears and couldn't get stops when needed to clinch games.

Fast forward the Week 17 and the Bengals still have the most missed tackles in the NFL (155), but have moved into second worst in the league for total yards and points allowed.

The Bengals need to get stops against the Cardinals' offense and get Burrow and the offense more opportunities to score points.

The Bengals have two games left in the 2026 season and suffering a major injury at this point could put the start of next season in question.

Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes injured his ACL and LCL in Week 15, but is expected to be ready for Week 1 of the 2026 NFL season.

The Bengals need to stay healthy and have a full offseason for their key players to have a regular start to next season.

This article originally appeared on Cincinnati Enquirer: Keys for the Bengals to beat the Arizona Cardinals

title: Updated Fantasy Football Start 'Em, Sit 'Em Week 17: Who should I start, Championship Week lineup advice, best matchups, DFS picks
description: Vinnie Iyer is back for another season of fantasy football lineup advice, bringing his rankings and insights across all positions to help you make those tough Week 17 start 'em, sit 'em decisions based on matchups, usage, and other factors.
fullText:
Updated Fantasy Football Start 'Em, Sit 'Em Week 17: Who should I start, Championship Week lineup advice, best matchups, DFS picks originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Welcome to the Week 17 edition of¬†fantasy football starts and sits from The Sporting News.

"The Decider" is your one-stop shop for fantasy start/sit lineup advice in 2025 -- a unique mashup of rankings and matchup breakdowns to help you make those tough decisions on whom to play and not to play:

There are several high-drafted fantasy players who should be in lineups every week when they're active. Those are the "regular starts."

For those borderline options with favorable matchups, they are "stronger starts," while the recommended sits are "weaker starts."

We're also basing our advice on 12-team, half-point PPR to split the difference between shallow and deep leagues and full-PPR and standard formats.

Going beyond the redraft league starts and sits, "The Decider" also includes some DFS picks for different styles of daily fantasy sports games on DraftKings and FanDuel.

Keep scrolling for how to put the best fantasy football lineups on "the field" for your critical Week 17 game with tips on starts and sits this week.

Jacoby Brissett, Cardinals (at CIN)

Matthew Stafford, Rams (at ATL)

10. Baker Mayfield, Buccaneers (at MIA): Mayfield needs a get-well game overall and the running game will facilitate that on the road.

12. Caleb Williams, Bears (at SF): Purdy and the Niners will force him into plenty of effective passing volume on Sunday night.

13. Tyler Shough, Saints (at TEN): Shough is getting better every week under Kellen Moore and the matchups also are aligning with giving him more productive confidence.

14. Geno Smith, Raiders (vs. NYG): This might feel weird to put him up this high but he should need to throw a ton opposite Dart in a sneaky but sloppy high-scoring game.

Jaxson Dart, Giants¬†(at LV,¬†$5,400 on DraftKings, $7,100 on FanDuel): Dart was headed to bad things against the Vikings' defense last week and now gets out of the MetLife elements to deliver his running and passing rookie fun again.

15. Justin Herbert, Chargers (vs. HOU): He might be still seeing ghosts from Christmas past given how the Texans ripped him in last year's playoffs.

16. C.J. Stroud, Texans (at LAC): The Chargers were rather good in containing Prescott on the road and Stroud is meh in tougher matchups.

17. Jared Goff, Lions (at MIN): Goff can't get it done one-dimensionally against a tough pass defense on the road.

18. Bo Nix, Broncos (at KC): Nix should have limited volume in a low-scoring game where a fourth-quarter comeback will not be required.

19. Sam Darnold, Seahawks (at CAR): The Seahawks should be relentless running the ball in this revenge game to attack the Panthers' big weakness on the road, playing off the defense.

20. Aaron Rodgers, Steelers (at CLE): He probably will be Myles Garrett's record-breaking sack victim even in a run-heavy game plan.

23. Kenneth Gainwell, Steelers (at CLE): Gainwell is living up to his last name game and the Steelers should lean plenty on the backs with no DK Metcalf.

Jaylen Warren, Steelers¬†(at CLE,¬†$6,600 on DraftKings, $7,400 on FanDuel): Warren is on a heater again in a lead role and the Browns are wilting against the run late.

Tony Pollard, Titans¬†(vs. NO,¬†$5,500 on DraftKings, $6,100 on FanDuel): Pollard is coming alive with Cam Ward providing some real offensive flash and it happens again here this time with a TD.

29. Omarion Hampton, Chargers (vs. HOU): He was limited in a great matchup in a blowout last week so we're down on his expectations against the much better defense from Texas.

Stefon Diggs, Patriots (at¬†NYJ,¬†$5,800 on DraftKings, $6,500 on FanDuel): Diggs got going again last week in a pristine matchup with the Ravens and the Jets offer no resistance.
